context: The Estonian word 'pea' has multiple meanings depending on context. It can mean 'head' (as in body part), 'main', 'first', or 'primary'. In the examples: 1) 'Tema on pea meie grupis' means 'He is head/chief of our group'; 2) 'Peame kohtuma kell kolm' uses it as an auxiliary verb form meaning 'must/should meet at three o'clock'; 3) 'See on peaasi' means 'This is the main thing/most important matter'. The word can function as a noun, adverb, or part of compound verbs in Estonian.
